text: The Boston National Historical Park (est. October 1, 1974) is a group of eight sites in Boston, Massachusetts associated with the American Revolutionary War: the Bunker Hill Monument; Charlestown Navy Yard; Dorchester Heights; Faneuil Hall; Old North Church; Old South Meeting House; Old State House; and the Paul Revere House. ==Gallery== File:Bunker hill 2009.JPG|Bunker Hill Monument File:Faneuil Hall Boston Massachusetts.JPG|Faneuil Hall File:Old State House Boston Massachusetts2.jpg|Old State House File:Old South Meeting House in Boston MA.jpg|Old South Meeting House Category:National Historical Parks of the United States
title: Boston National Historical Park
